intro: Lantana kingii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dune environments. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems due to its extensive root system. Lantana kingii is also valued for its ornamental qualities and traditional uses by Māori.
